docs.snippet: On Tuesday night, the Royals won a game their fans can celebrate all winter. The A’s, meanwhile, have now lost their last seven winner-take-all postseason games....
docs.lead_paragraph: On Tuesday night, the Royals won a game their fans can celebrate all winter. The A’s, meanwhile, have now lost their last seven winner-take-all postseason games.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column applauds Kansas City Royal for victory in game against Oakland Athletics that their fans can celebrate all winter, and perhaps beyond, if it becomes springboard for a deep October run; notes that A’s, meanwhile, have now lost their last seven winner-take-all postseason games, leaving their fans a bit jealous.

headline.seo: Royals Emerge Victorious and A's Leave With Another Postseason Loss
headline.main: New Joy, and a Sadly Familiar Ending

docs.snippet: With the Yankees missing the playoffs for a second consecutive season, Hal Steinbrenner, the team’s managing general partner, borrowed his father’s tactic from the aftermath of the 1981 World Series and apologized to fans....
docs.lead_paragraph: With the Yankees missing the playoffs for a second consecutive season, Hal Steinbrenner, the team’s managing general partner, borrowed his father’s tactic from the aftermath of the 1981 World Series and apologized to fans.
docs.abstract: Hal Steinbrenner, New York Yankees managing general partner, apologizes to fans for team's missing playoffs for second consecutive season.

headline.main: Hal Steinbrenner Apologizes for Yanks’ Year

docs.snippet: An 8-0 wild-card victory gave San Francisco its seventh consecutive win in a playoff elimination game. The Giants advanced to face the Nationals in an N.L. division series....
docs.lead_paragraph: An 8-0 wild-card victory gave San Francisco its seventh consecutive win in a playoff elimination game. The Giants advanced to face the Nationals in an N.L. division series.
docs.abstract: San Francisco Giants rout Pittsburgh Pirates, 8-0, and advance to National League division series.

headline.main: Giants’ Madison Bumgarner and a Grand Slam Extinguish the Pirates’ Hopes
headline.print_headline: No Suspense on This Night as Giants Coast Past Pirates

docs.snippet: After two years as a catcher in the Bronx, Martin has made it to the postseason twice with Pittsburgh....

headline.main: Former Yankee Russell Martin Helps Lead the Pirates
headline.print_headline: Back in Playoffs With Pirates, an Ex-Yankee Has No Regrets

docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner American League Division Series Preview; Brandon Finnegan, a hard-throwing rookie, could be Kansas City Royals' secret weapon against Los Angeles Angels in their American League division series; Angels’ Mike Trout, viewed by concensus as the best player in baseball, makes his postseason debut in series.

headline.main: Pitcher Brandon Finnegan Could Change Royals’ Fortunes

docs.snippet: As the Angels begin an American League division series against the Royals, Albert Pujols, an October fixture with the Cardinals, is returning to a familiar stage....
docs.lead_paragraph: As the Angels begin an American League division series against the Royals, Albert Pujols, an October fixture with the Cardinals, is returning to a familiar stage.
docs.abstract: Los Angeles Angels are preparing for an American League division series against the Kansas City Royals, and Albert Pujols, an October fixture with the St Louis Cardinals for 11 seasons, is preparing his own return to the big stage.

headline.main: Angels’ Albert Pujols Is Back in Form and Back in the Postseason
headline.print_headline: Back in Form and Back in the Postseason

docs.snippet: Derek Jeter, who gave guarded answers to the news media during his playing career, said he would publish The Players’ Tribune, giving sports stars a way to express themselves without a filter....
docs.lead_paragraph: Derek Jeter, who gave guarded answers to the news media during his playing career, said he would publish The Players’ Tribune, giving sports stars a way to express themselves without a filter.
docs.abstract: Derek Jeter is joining news media just three days after playing his final baseball game with New York Yankees; announces he will publish The Players’ Tribune, a website that gives athletes a forum to share first-person accounts, videos, podcasts and photographs.

headline.main: Suddenly Chatty, Jeter Starts Web Forum
headline.print_headline: Suddenly Chatty, Jeter Starts Web Forum

docs.snippet: On Oct. 1, 1952, the Brooklyn Dodgers faced the New York Yankees at Ebbets Field in the first game of the World Series. Although the Yankees went on to win, the Dodgers got off to a blazing start....
docs.abstract: On Oct. 1, 1952, the Brooklyn Dodgers faced the New York Yankees at Ebbets Field in the first game of the World Series. Although the Yankees went on to win, the Dodgers got off to a blazing start.
